rules.name: Create Test File
rules.condition: calculator.py exists and contains the Calculator class with all basic operations
rules.action: Create a new file named test_calculator.py in the same directory as calculator.py
rules.expected_outcome: test_calculator.py file is created and ready for test cases

rules.name: Run All Test Cases
rules.condition: All test cases for add, subtract, multiply, and divide operations are written in test_calculator.py
rules.action: Execute all test cases in test_calculator.py using a Python test runner
rules.expected_outcome: All test cases pass, confirming the Calculator class operations work as expected

rules.name: Write Test Cases for Add Operation
rules.action: Write unit tests for the add method in the Calculator class
rules.expected_outcome: Test cases for the add operation are written and ready to be executed

rules.name: Write Test Cases for Subtract Operation
rules.condition: Test cases for add operation are written in test_calculator.py
rules.action: Write unit tests for the subtract method in the Calculator class
rules.expected_outcome: Test cases for the subtract operation are written and ready to be executed

rules.name: Write Test Cases for Multiply Operation
rules.condition: Test cases for subtract operation are written in test_calculator.py
rules.action: Write unit tests for the multiply method in the Calculator class
rules.expected_outcome: Test cases for the multiply operation are written and ready to be executed

rules.name: Write Test Cases for Divide Operation
